scenarios.title: Following Instructions at School

listening.receptive: Follow clear instructions in learning activities.
listening.interactive: Execute multi-step directions in learning activities.

reading.reading: Show comprehension of written instructions for classroom activities.
reading.reading2: Demonstrate comprehension of basic descriptions in texts.
reading.phonemic_awareness: Decode English graphemes and phonemes using knowledge of word parts, syllabification, and phonemic awareness.

speaking.productive: Talk about simple rules and laws.
speaking.interactive: Answer questions about their daily routine.

writing.interactive: Respond to written questions about a class reading assignment.

mediation.text: Contextualize simple school announcements according to local needs.

grammar: Plural of the imperatives (e.g., 'Let's make a poster.')
Sequencing words (e.g., 'first, next')
Future tense (e.g., 'I will make a mask.', 'I am going to make a mask.')
linguistic.phonemic_awareness: Recognition of compound words and syllable division (e.g., 'classroom', 'class-room', two syllables)

pragmatic: Asking for clarification: 'What do I need to do next?'
Communicating future intentions: 'I will make a hat!'
sociolinguistic: Collaborating: Using imperatives and 'let's' for group activities.

assessment_ideas: Observe student responses during 'Where Am I?' map activities.
Review digital map tours with 'I'm at...' labels.
Assess use of contractions and prepositions in location drawings.

scenarios.title: Taking Care of Our Class

listening.receptive: Identify specific information in announcements or recordings.
listening.interactive: Ask for repetition and clarification in a conversation about known topics.

reading.reading: Extract specific information from short informational texts.
reading.reading2: Demonstrate comprehension of basic descriptions in texts.
reading.phonemic_awareness: Decode English graphemes and phonemes using knowledge of word parts, syllabification, and phonemic awareness.

speaking.productive: Give simple directions within the school.
speaking.interactive: Participate in short conversations about familiar topics.

writing.productive: Create short descriptions of favorite characters from books.
writing.interactive: Draft questions for guest speakers, including imaginary 'guests' or 'characters' of relevance.

mediation.text: Explain simple written instructions to peers.
mediation.communication: Facilitate discussions on classroom topics among peers.

grammar: Present continuous (e.g., 'We are sweeping.')
Imperatives (e.g., 'Sweep.', 'Let's sweep.')
Modal 'can' in affirmative and interrogative form (e.g., 'I can sweep the floor.', 'Can you help me wipe down the desks?')
linguistic.phonemic_awareness: Recognition of compound words and syllable division (e.g., 'whiteboard', 'white-board', two syllables)

pragmatic: Offering help: 'Can I help you sweep?'
sociolinguistic: Collaborating in class: Using 'please' to maintain politeness in interactions when giving instructions, fostering inclusion and solidarity.

assessment_ideas: Observe participation in polite request role-plays.
Review collaborative dialogues with 'Can I...' and 'Sorry, I can't...'.
Assess use of polite expressions in digital posters.

scenarios.title: The Local Farm Stand

listening.receptive: Identify specific information in announcements or recordings.
listening.interactive: Engage in simple discussions on lessons or current events.

reading.reading: Comprehend short narratives about familiar experiences.
reading.reading2: Extract specific information from texts on familiar topics.
reading.phonemic_awareness: Decode English graphemes and phonemes using knowledge of word parts, syllabification, and phonemic awareness.

speaking.productive: Talk about people or things using simple language.

writing.productive: Create basic informational leaflets for the event.
writing.interactive: Write simple group summaries of chapters read in class.

mediation.communication: Assist peers in following multi-step school procedures.
mediation.concept: Explain the steps to solve a problem using practical examples.

grammar: Polite requests (e.g., 'Can you help me, please?')
WH-questions (e.g., 'How much is...?')
'Some' and 'any' with countable/non-countable nouns (e.g., 'Do you have any apples?', 'I would like some water.')
linguistic.phonemic_awareness: Segmenting words in syllables (e.g., 'banana' to 'ba-na-na' has three syllables)

pragmatic: Asking about prices: 'How much is this?'
Asking about availability: 'Do you have any...?'
Describing availability: 'We have some...', 'I don't have any...'
sociolinguistic: Discussing prices: Using polite expressions and transactional language at a farm stand.

assessment_ideas: Observe participation in shopping role-plays.
Review farm stand price lists with quantities and prices.
Assess digital shopping lists with pictures and quantities.

scenarios.title: Helping Around the House
themes: I Wash the Dishes Every day.

listening.receptive: Demonstrate comprehension of the main points of extended discussions on familiar topics.
listening.interactive: Engage in role-plays based on familiar social situations.

reading.reading: Identify main ideas on familiar topics in simple paragraphs.
reading.phonemic_awareness: Decode English graphemes and phonemes using knowledge of word parts, syllabification, and phonemic awareness.

speaking.productive: Describe favorite hobbies or activities briefly.
speaking.interactive: Exchange information about hobbies with peers.

mediation.concept: Use visual aids to explain basic concepts.

grammar: Present simple (e.g., 'I wash.', 'He washes.', 'I don't like to wash the dishes.')
WH-questions (e.g., 'What do you do at home?', 'How often do you clean?')
Frequency adverbs (e.g., every day)
linguistic.phonemic_awareness: Recognition of closed and open syllables (e.g., closed syllable: 'cook', open syllable: 'do')

pragmatic: Asking about chores: 'What do you do at home?'
sociolinguistic: Discussing routines: Describing daily tasks and house chores according to context.

assessment_ideas: Review chore scheduling apps with routines and frequencies.
Observe family chore posters with present simple tense.
Assess chore murals with drawings and descriptions.

listening.receptive: Comprehend the gist of short stories and news items.
listening.interactive: Engage in simple discussions on lessons or current events.

scenarios.title: Recycling for Our World
themes: We Recycle Plastic Bottles Every Day.

listening.receptive: Demonstrate comprehension of the main points of extended discussions on familiar topics.
listening.interactive: Ask for repetition and clarification in a conversation about known topics.

reading.reading: Comprehend short narratives about familiar experiences.
reading.phonemic_awareness: Decode English graphemes and phonemes using knowledge of word parts, syllabification, and phonemic awareness.

speaking.productive: Give a simple report based on a chart.

writing.productive: Write short reports on classroom experiments or projects.
writing.interactive: Write phrases or sentences for a group story or project with support or guidance.

mediation.communication: Assist peers in following multi-step school procedures.
mediation.concept: Explain the steps to solve a problem using practical examples.

grammar: Present simple (e.g., 'We recycle.')
Modal verbs can/could (e.g., 'Could you clarify that please?', 'We can recycle paper in the school.')
There is/there are (e.g., 'There is a recycling center in the community.')
linguistic.phonemic_awareness: Segmenting multisyllabic words into syllables (e.g., dividing 'environment' into 'en-vi-ron-ment')

pragmatic: Asking questions about recycling: 'What can we recycle?'
Giving reasons: 'We recycle to help the planet.'
sociolinguistic: Discussing environmental actions: discussing taking care of the environment.

assessment_ideas: Review recycling station posters with present simple tense and modals.
Observe recycling data charts with frequency adverbs.
Assess recycling campaign videos with sustainability actions.

scenarios.title: Conservation Morning, Noon, and Night!
themes: Let's Get Cool in the Shade.

listening.receptive: Comprehend the gist of short stories and news items.
listening.interactive: Contribute actively to group projects and discussions.

reading.reading: Respond to texts with personal reflections.
reading.reading2: Participate in group discussions based on reading assignments.
reading.phonemic_awareness: Decode English graphemes and phonemes using knowledge of word parts, syllabification, and phonemic awareness.

speaking.interactive: Express likes and dislikes in group discussions.

writing.productive: Write instructions for playing a simple classroom game.
writing.interactive: Write instructions for peers about how to improve their writing products.

mediation.communication: Assist peers in following multi-step school procedures.
mediation.communication2: Relay key points from the teacher's lectures to absent students.

grammar: Imperatives (e.g., 'Turn off the lights when not in use.', 'Let's save energy.')
Comparatives (e.g., 'easier than')
Superlatives (e.g., 'the most important')
linguistic.phonemic_awareness: Introducing simple prefixes and suffixes (e.g., '-re' in 'recycle', '-er' in 'safer')

pragmatic: Giving and following suggested actions: 'Use natural light when possible.', 'Turn off appliances when they are not needed.'
Expressing preferences: 'I prefer saving energy wherever possible because it is beneficial and better for the environment.'
sociolinguistic: Comparing actions: Using comparatives and superlatives to discuss conservation.

assessment_ideas: Review daily conservation logs with imperative forms.
Observe conservation vs. recycling posters with comparatives.
Assess energy saving challenge results with comparative descriptions.
